_prev_prog_2.FR_Comments: Missouri, Code of State Regulations, Title 2-Dept. of Ag. (Missouri title 2 CSR 90-11.010)
_prev_prog_2.PC_OtherType: Administrative controls (operation procedures in place, speed limit, etc.), excess flow automatic shut-down valves, load-out riser breakaway system and remote manual emergency shutoff valves.
_prev_prog_2.MD_OtherType: Routine visual inspections by trained operators
_prev_prog_2.EquipmentTested: Storage Tanks, and associated piping and transfer equipment.

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Risk Management Plan - Executive Summary


Facility Office:  Professional Ag Services, Inc.
    P.O. Box 628 
    Lathrop, MO 64465
Facility:  Professional Ag Services, Inc.
   99 NE 280th Street
   Plattsburg, MO 64477
Contact:  Chad O'Connor
Phone:   816-740-6720

1. Facility Policy.

        The owners, management and employees of Professional Ag Services, Inc. are committed to the prevention of any accidental releases of anhydrous ammonia.  If an accidental release should occur, the facility is prepared to work with the local fire department, Clinton County LEPC / Emergency Management, and/or other authorities, to mitigate and minimize the impacts of the release to the people and the environment.

2. Facility Information.

        The primary activity at the facility is the distribution of products to area farmers.  The fertilizer product, anhydrous ammonia is received, store and distributed for direct application as a nutrient for crop production.  At times, Anhydrous ammonia is also stored on site in nurse tanks designed for this purpose.  The facility is manned year round during normal business hours.

3.	The Worst-Case Release Scenario and the Alternate Release Scenario 

         An analysis of the potential off-site consequences of hypothetical worst-case and alternative-case accidental releases have been addressed in our Hazard Assessment and information is in our Risk Management Program.

4.	Accidental Release Prevention Program

        The facility is in compliance with the provisions of the U.S. Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA), 29 CFR 1910.111, Storage and handling of anhydrous ammonia and state regulations covering anhydrous ammonia.  The OSHA standard is referenced in this RMP Registration Form; see Section 8.3 (b).

5.	Five-Year Accident History.

        There have been no accidental releases of anhydrous ammonia in the past five years that have caused any deaths, injuries or significant prope

rty damage at the facility; nor to our knowledge, has THERE BEEN ANY ACCIDENTAL RELEASES resulting in off-site deaths, injuries, evacuations, property damage, or environmental damage.

6.	Emergency Action Plan.

         The facility has:

          a.   A written emergency action plan, in accordance with OSHA standard 29 CFR 1910.38;

          b.   Provided state and local authorities with the emergency planning and Community right-to-know information as required under SARA Title III EPCRA);

          c.   If a large release of anhydrous ammonia takes place at the facility, the required response action is to evacuate the area of the release and call 911 and all applicable emergency response numbers listed in our Emergency Action Plan.

7.	Planned Changes to Improve Safety.

        Safety improvement is an on-going process at the facility.  Our company is committed to the safety and health our employees as well as our community and area we serve.  Periodic evaluations are performed to assess the conditions at our facility.   There are no additional specific safety recommendations regarding storage or use of anhydrous ammonia for implementation at this time.
